climbs.name: Fire in the Hole
climbs.fa: Greg Hughes, Michel Martin and Francesca Zambito, May 2018

content.description:
This is a great little climb with super fun movement throughout capped off by an enjoyable topout. If you don't dial the beta it could feel harder than 5.8.

Find the climb Biohazard (route #1 in the guide book) and then walk north west about 20 feet to find the Phoenix. The route is located directly below the Phoenix. There are easy scrambles down from the left or right.
A small rack consisting of a #3 camalot to protect the moves under the roof and finger sized pieces for the the crack above the roof.

Scramble up grassy ledges to gain vertical rock split by a crack. Follow this to a short slab and up a final overhang with a beautiful hand crack.

near the left side of the main Striated wall. Look for a large blocky corner. This route climbs the crack on the left face of the corner.
standard rack to BD #2. Bolted anchor
This was originally an aid route route put up by Steve Adamson. The first free ascent was done in 1992 by Karel Allard and given a grade of 5.10+.

Crimp your way up the face, making occasional use of the arête to a crux near the top where the holds get pretty small!
A great route with excellent and interesting movement.

The bolted face just left of the arête.
bolts. bolted anchor

climbs.name: The Phoenix
climbs.fa: Greg Hughes, Michel Martin and Francesca Zambito, May 2018

content.description:
Better than it looks! Climb discontinuous cracks to the top of the block.

Far left hand side of Striated - like really far, as in 20 feet past Biohazard which is the first route in the guide book.
A light rack will do.

Easy climbing up a chimney leads to a distinct move as you escape from the chimney to the main face.  A tricky top out leads to a bolted anchor or a tree.

This climb starts at the obvious left trending ramp/chimney on the right side of Striated.
Standard Rack.  Bolted/Tree Anchor.

Start up the gully for Ride a Cock Horse. Leave the gulley and climb an obvious V-groove/crack. Skirt right around a roof and continue to the top of the cliff.
Tricky and funky climbing and slightly tricky gear. A pretty unique route.

Starts in the gulley which turns into a chimney. Starts in the same spot as Ride a Cock Horse and Escape Hatch but then climbs up the V-groove in the face.
Rap ring anchor. Some small gear up to about 1.5"

A little contrived since the upper arête climbs close to the crack for J'ai Volé ta Blonde, but really fun movement makes up for it.

Climb easily up a corner then a slab to gain the steep arête above. Grab a couple jugs then launch into the business. Slap up the arête and vertical seam, topping out on a good ledge.

note: the 4th bolt (above the pink jug) can be very difficult to clip. It's not a bad idea to pre-place a draw.


The bolt line on the right side of the prominent arête.
bolts, rap rings

For the most part Striated doesn't see a lot of action.  The more popular routes like Biohazard, J'ai volé ta blonde, and Ride A Cock Horse see a few ascents a year.  If you are looking to climb something else in this area a wire brush will be a welcome addition to your trad rack. 
  
 Striated sees afternoon and evening sun.
